item.title: Scientists not backing Covid jabs for 12 to 15-year-olds
item.description: But 200,000 extra children with underlying conditions will now be eligible for two doses.

item.title: Why vaccinating all teens is a difficult decision
item.description: Concerns over a very rare heart side-effect are giving vaccine experts pause for thought.

item.title: National Insurance: Minister refuses to deny reports of tax hike for social care
item.description: The justice secretary says social care must be properly funded but declines to "speculate" on plans.

item.title: Covid: Australia to get Pfizer doses from UK in vaccine swap
item.description: The UK will send four million Pfizer doses now to help Australia exit lockdowns, Canberra says.

item.title: EU and AstraZeneca reach deal to end vaccine row
item.description: AstraZeneca agrees to deliver 200 million doses by next spring, ending the threat of court action.

item.title: Covid: Schools aren't infection hubs, says public health boss
item.description: Dr Yvonne Doyle seeks to reassure parents as pupils head back to classrooms across the country.

item.title: Coronavirus vaccines cut risk of long Covid, study finds
item.description: The study adds to growing evidence that vaccination helps protect against Covid in a number of ways.

item.title: Warning over cuts to NHS services without Â£10bn extra funding
item.description: Without the extra funding for England patients could be put at risk, NHS organisations warn.

item.title: Third Covid jab advised for most vulnerable 1%
item.description: More than 400,000 people in the UK are eligible - but plans for further boosters are yet to be confirmed.

item.title: Long Covid in children 'nowhere near scale feared'
item.description: Public should be reassured over rates of persistent symptoms, leading child health experts say.

item.title: Life-saving cholesterol jab recommended on NHS
item.description: Inclisiran is a new treatment that works even when other fat-busting drugs, like statins, have not.

item.title: Texas passes law banning abortion after six weeks
item.description: The law, one of the most restrictive in the US, passes as the Supreme Court fails to block it.

item.title: Air pollution may reduce life expectancy of Indians by nine years, says study
item.description: Millions in north India face the most extreme levels of air pollution in the world, the report says.

item.title: New Zealand woman dies after receiving Pfizer vaccine
item.description: Officials say she also had other medical issues which could have contributed to her death.

item.title: Rugby study finds brain affected in one season
item.description: One season of professional rugby could be enough to see a decline in a player's blood flow to the brain and cognitive function, a new study claims.

item.title: Covid-19: Irish Cabinet agrees to end most restrictions by 22 October
item.description: Ministers met on Tuesday to agree on a plan to ease most Covid-19 restrictions by 22 October.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Record number of cases as NHS faces 'perfect storm'
item.description: A total of 7,113 new cases have been recorded in the last 24 hours, topping the previous high from Friday.

item.title: Covid: Australia records 1,000th death from the pandemic
item.description: The country has fared better than many nations but is seeing more infections than ever before.

item.title: Covid: Teen in hospital with virus urges others to get vaccinated
item.description: Maisy Evans, 17, is in hospital and is so short of breath she can barely talk.

item.title: NHS blood test tube shortage: Doctors 'facing difficult choices'
item.description: Doctors call for more guidance after the NHS in England and Wales stops all non-urgent blood tests.

item.title: Covid origin: US spy agencies publish 'inconclusive' report
item.description: The office that oversees US spy agencies could not establish how the coronavirus pandemic began.

item.title: Covid: Delta variant patients twice as likely to need hospital care
item.description: Get double-jabbed to reduce this risk, advise experts who have studied different variants of the virus.

item.title: Social care charges: Disabled and vulnerable adults hit by steep rises
item.description: Many are facing a significant rise in the money they have to pay towards the support they receive.

item.title: High Street chemists to offer free blood pressure checks
item.description: The NHS initiative, for people in England over the age of 40, could save thousands of lives.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Warning over restrictions as cases hit new high
item.description: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon says "limited and proportionate" restrictions could be in reintroduced.

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Millions of children, including 16 to 17-year-olds, are now being offered a Covid vaccine.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in other parts of the UK.

item.title: How many cases in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: All over-16s in the UK can get the Covid vaccine, as well as some vulnerable younger teens.

item.title: What are the Delta, Gamma, Beta and Alpha Covid variants?
item.description: UK coronavirus cases are rising due to a variant first identified in India that spreads more easily.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing in Wales, Scotland, England and Northern Ireland?
item.description: Lockdown rules are changing across the UK, but some restrictions remain in place.

item.title: Covid: How do I get the vaccine and will I need a booster?
item.description: A third dose is being offered to up to half a million people in the UK with weakened immune systems.

item.title: How do we know Covid vaccines are safe?
item.description: Busting myths and explaining the facts around vaccines.

item.title: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
item.description: What is it like to have the coronavirus, how will it affect you and how is it treated?

item.title: Support bubbles: How do they work and who is in yours?
item.description: Some people across the UK have been able to form "support bubbles" or "extended households".

item.title: How to get a Covid test
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

item.title: All you need to know on the coronavirus
item.description: A new cough, fever and change in smell or taste are the key symptoms that mean you may have coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Intensive care and other key terms explained
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: What is the risk to men over 50?
item.description: While most people will have mild symptoms and recover quickly, some are more prone to getting sick.

item.title: Coronavirus: Do face masks actually work?
item.description: With face masks in high demand, we look at whether they really can protect people from the virus.

item.title: Mental Health: The ambulance workers feeding callers
item.description: A Merseyside mental health ambulance team is offering food support for its most in need patients.

item.title: The fishing group supporting men with their mental health
item.description: Thomas Campbell, who suffered with addiction, set up the fishing group as a safe space for men.

item.title: 'Vaccine blood clot risk far smaller than Covid risks'
item.description: A study looked at 29 million people who'd had a single dose of AstraZeneca or Pfizer vaccine.

item.title: Billy Connolly: Challenges of Parkinson's getting worse
item.description: The 78-year old has retired from live performances and says that making TV programmes is getting more difficult.

item.title: Autism and anxiety: One man 'failed by the system'
item.description: Autistic teen posted a video about lack of support in health and social care system before he died.
